ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Learned about how text can be effectively laid out, creative methods of dealing with text, and how to explore typefaces.

Often we'd have to set our own constraints on our project (content, size, etc.), which I think is a vital as a designer. Working on these projects, along with Henk's weekly feedback, forced me to think more critically about my designs. I did see a great improvement of my work over the course of the semester.
How to balance 2 subjects in one poster, how to keep track of the whole picture when you have to design every page in a book. We didn't have time to get to the moving type project.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I liked that we only had 3 projects because it allowed us to have a lot of focus on them. The small class size also allowed us to receive a significant amount of feedback which was really helpful for improving. Because it meets only once a week, that can be tricky sometimes.
enjoyed the crits with student input and outside guest critics

Strengths: in-depth group critiques, presentations with examples of design concepts which would be discussed in later critiques.
Weaknesses: not much guidance for people who don't know where to get materials or how to print high-quality or how to bind a book.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! If you are interested in improving your skills in Typography this is a good class to bring them to the next level.
Yes, if you are interested in developing a solid foundation in graphic design and wish to improve your skills, then this course is a must.
absolutely if youre looking to continue your typography studies

Yes, I recommend it. I wish ART 264 was not a prerequisite for this class because a lot of people fulfill their requirement in the graphic design concentration with 264 and then have no space left in their schedules to consider 265. Actually in 265 you get to learn the same ideas from 264 plus an intriguing introduction to moving graphic design.
